segments.text: You know Iden , I don ’ t know much about you . Where were you born ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I was born in London , but I spent most of my childhood in Hongkong .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I had a pretty strict up-bring , and my parents and I were always fighting about it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you get along with your parents now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , sure . Once they reached middle age , they became a lot less uptight .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Where did you go to university ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My parents wanted me to stay in Hongkong , but I decided to go back to England , I graduated from Oxford University with a degree in English literature .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ m a freelance writer . i write magazine articles and fiction books
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Did you always know you wanted to be a writer ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I didn ’ t . I was an english teacher for about five years , but by the time I was thirty , I decided I want a fresh challenge .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I started writing margin articles for fun , and eventually was asked to write a book , so I was pretty lucky .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Are you writing a book now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it ’ s about a group of friends living in a foreign country , and all the strange experiences they have
segments.speaker: S2
